summary: The White Oak Resiliency Act of 2025 aims to promote white oak restoration and conservation. It establishes a White Oak Restoration Initiative Coalition to coordinate efforts, directs the Secretary of Agriculture and Secretary of the Interior to conduct assessments and pilot projects, and creates a White Oak and Upland Oak Habitat Regeneration Program. The bill also addresses tree nursery shortages, funds research on white oak health and genetics, and establishes a Natural Resources Conservation Service initiative focused on white oak management and restoration. The goal is to improve the health, regeneration, and resilience of white oak forests across the United States.
